form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Ms. Klobuchar (for herself, Mr. Welch, Ms. Smith, Mr. King, Ms. Cantwell, Mr. Reed, Mr. Whitehouse, Ms. Duckworth, Ms. Warren, Mrs. Gillibrand, Mr. Merkley, Mrs. Murray, Mr. Blumenthal, Mrs. Shaheen, Ms. Cortez Masto, Ms. Baldwin, Mr. Booker, Mr. Van Hollen, Mr. Durbin, Mr. Murphy, Mr. Fetterman, Mr. Markey, Mr. Luján, Ms. Hassan, Mr. Heinrich, Ms. Slotkin, and Mr. Bennet) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to strengthen the drug pricing reforms in the Inflation Reduction Act.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Strengthening Medicare And Reducing Taxpayer Prices Act or the SMART Prices Act.

section.header: Improvements to the Medicare Drug Price Negotiation Program

subsection.header: Acceleration of the selection of negotiation-Eligible drugs
subsection.text: Section 1192(a) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1320f–1(a)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking 2028, 15 negotiation-eligible drugs and inserting 2028 or a subsequent year, 50 negotiation-eligible drugs; and
by striking ; and at the end and inserting a period; and

subsection.header: Improvements to the definition of qualifying single source drug
subsection.text: Section 1192(e)(1) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1320f–1(e)(1)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (A)(ii), by striking 7 years and inserting 3 years; and
in subparagraph (B)(ii), by striking 11 years and inserting 3 years.

subsection.header: Improvement to the ceiling for maximum fair price
subsection.text: Section 1194(c)(3) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1320f–3(c)(3)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking 75 percent and inserting 76 percent;
in subparagraph (B), by striking 65 percent and inserting 55 percent; and
in subparagraph (C), by striking 40 percent and inserting 30 percent.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply with respect to initial price applicability years (as defined in section 1191(b) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1320f(b))) beginning with initial price applicability year 2028.
